TypeSignature.Value: public class IdentityHashMap : Java.Util.AbstractMap, IDisposable, Java.IO.ISerializable, Java.Lang.ICloneable

.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit IdentityHashMap extends Java.Util.AbstractMap implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.IO.ISerializable, class Java.Lang.ICloneable, class Java.Util.IMap, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: IdentityHashMap is a variant on HashMap which tests equality by reference instead of equality by value.

remarks.para: IdentityHashMap is a variant on HashMap which tests equality by reference instead of equality by value. Basically, keys and values are compared for equality by checking if their references are equal rather than by calling the "equals" function.

format.b: Note: This class intentionally violates the general contract of Map's on comparing objects by their equals method.

remarks.para: IdentityHashMap uses open addressing (linear probing in particular) for collision resolution. This is different from HashMap which uses Chaining.
Like HashMap, IdentityHashMap is not thread safe, so access by multiple threads must be synchronized by an external mechanism such as Collections.synchronizedMap.

Docs.summary: Returns a set containing all of the mappings in this map.

remarks.para: Returns a set containing all of the mappings in this map. Each mapping is an instance of . As the set is backed by this map, changes in one will be reflected in the other.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
